intro.text: Welcome to the portal where you can check your knowlege in web-development

questions.question: What does declaration DOCTYPE tell the web browser?
answers: Which version of HTML the page is written in.
questions.explanation: A DOCTYPE declaration must be specified on the first line of each web document:The DOCTYPE tells the web browser which version of HTML the page is written in.

questions.question: The <title> element defines...
answers: ...what text will show on the top of page.
...what text will show in the web browser’s title bar.
questions.explanation: The <title> element defines what text will show in the web browser’s title bar.

questions.question: Choose correct statement.
answers: The <body> element surrounds all the special “behind the scenes” elements of a web document.  Most of these elements do not get displayed directly on the web page.
Every web document must include one and only one instance of DOCTYPE, <html>, <head>, <body>, and <title>.
The basic structure of an HTML document consists of 7 elements.
questions.explanation: Every web document must include one and only one instance of DOCTYPE, <html>, <head>, <body>, and <title>.

questions.question: Choose correct image of tag structure.
questions.explanation: HTML element consist of an opening tag, content and a closing tag.

questions.question: What type of list can be used on html-page?
questions.explanation: There are only ordered <ol> and unordere <ul> lists.

questions.question: How to write correctly <link> tag to connect a style file?
questions.explanation: Tag <link> should have two attributes rel="stylesheet" and href="styles/reset.css".

questions.question: Choose correct definition. Selector it is...
answers: ...description of the element or group of elements to which css-properties are applied.
...part of the tag that allows you to change its behavior or add metadata.
questions.explanation: A CSS selector is the part of a CSS rule set that actually selects the content you want to style.

questions.question: Choose a property that sets the text color.
questions.explanation: The "color" property determines the text color of the element.

questions.question: Choose the answer in which all the values ​​that the text-align property can take are indicated.
questions.explanation: These are the traditional values for text-align: left - The default value. Content aligns along the left side; right - Content aligns along the right side; center - Content centers between the left and right edges. White space on the left and right sides of each line should be equal; justify - Content spaces out such that as many blocks fit onto one line as possible and the first word on that line is along the left edge and the last word is along the right edge.

questions.question: Select the answer in which the border property is set correctly.
questions.explanation: The CSS border properties allow you to specify the width, style and color of an element's border.
